bitfield.description: REG_THSPREPARE timing parameter in multiples of DDR clock period. DDR clock = CLKIN4DDR/4. D-PHY spec:40ns+4UI-85ns+6UI Auctual value seen on line : = REG_THSPREPARE timer + analog delay & slew on signals = REG_THSPREPARE +(-26.5ns -- +4 ns ) PROGRAMMED VALUE = ceil( 70 ns / DDR Clock Period) + 2 Default value is programmed for 400 MHz

REG_THSPREPARE_THSZERO timing parameter in multiples of DDR clock period. DDR clock = CLKIN4DDR/4. D-PHY spec: > 145ns + 10 UI Actual value seen on line N= REG_THSPREPARE_THSZERO - REG_THSPREPARE M=REG_THSPREPARE = [ceil [(N+3)/4] * 4 + ceil [M/4] * 4 + 3] * DDR_Clock_Period+[~-29ns - 0ns] PROGRAMMED VALUE = ceil ( 175 ns/ DDR Clock Period ) + 2 Default value is programmed for 400 MHz

REG_THSTRAIL timing parameter in multiples of DDR clock period. DDR clock = CLKIN4DDR/4. D-PHY spec : > 60ns + 4UI Actual value seen on line : N = REG_THSTRAIL = [ceil [(N+3)/4] * 4 - 2.75] * DDR_Clock_period +(~ 0ns - 5ns) PROGRAMMED VALUE = ceil ( 60 ns / DDR Clock Period ) + 5 Default value is programmed for 400 MHz

REG_THSEXIT timing parameter in multiples of DDR clock frequency. DDR clock = CLKIN4DDR/4. D-PHy spec : > 100 ns Actual value seen on line : N = REG_THSEXIT = THSEXIT timer + analog delay & slew on LP signals = [ceil[N/4] * 4 ] * DDR_CLOCK_PERIOD - (~3 ns - 45 ns ) PROGRAMMED VALUE = ceil ( 145 ns/ DDR Clock Period) Default value is programmed for 400 MHz

TTA-GO timing in terms of number of TXCLKESC clocks 000 == 2 cycles 001 == 3 cycles 010 == 4 cycles 011 == 5 cycles 100 == 6 cycles 101 == 7 cycles 110 == 8 cycles 111 == 9 cycles Default value: 4 cycles
TTA-SURE timing in terms of number of TXCLKESC clocks 00 == 2 cycles 01 == Reserved 10 == 3 cycles 11 == 4 cycles Default value: 2 cycles

TTA-GET timing in terms of number of TXCLKESC clocks 000 == 3 cycles 001 == 4 cycles 010 == 5 cycles 011 == 6 cycles 100 == 7 cycles 101 == 8 cycles 110 == 9 cycles 111 == 10 cycles Default value: 5 cycles

(TLPX)/2 timing parameter in multiples of DDR clock frequency. DDR clock = CLKIN4DDR/4. PROGRAMMED VALUE = ceil (25 ns / DDR Clock Period ) Default value is programmed for 400 MHz Note : TLPX is used to define the length of LP-01 state in HS start of Transmision sequences on clock and data lanes. For all other purposes TLPX is defined by the period of TXLPESC

REG_TCLKTRAIL timing parameter in multiples of DDR clock frequency. DDR clock = CLKIN4DDR/4. D-PHY spec : 60 ns PROGRAMMED VALUE = ceil (60 ns / DDR Clock Period) Actual value seen on line: N = REG_TCLKTRAIL = [ceil[(N+3)/4] *4 - 1.5] * DDR_Clock_Period + (~0 ns - 5 ns) PROGRAMMED VALUE = ceil (60 ns / DDR Clock Period ) + 2 Default value is programmed for 400 MHz

REG_TCLKZERO timing parameter in multiples of DDR clock period. DDR clock = CLKIN4DDR/4. D-PHY spec :[REG_TCLKPREPARE + REG_TCLKZERO] > 300 ns Derived spec for REG_TCLKERO (Min REG_TCLKPREPARE = 38 ns) REG_TCLKZERO > 262 ns Actual value seen on line : N = REG_TCLKZERO M = REG_TCLKPREPARE = [ceil [(N+3)/4] *4 + ceil (M/4) * 4 - M + 2] * DDR_Clock_Period + [~0ns - 5ns] PROGRA MMED VALUE = ceil (265 ns / DDR Clock Period) Default value is programmed for 400 MHz
Default : 184 (10111000). MSB (last received bit of sync pattern), LSB (first received bit of sync pattern).
This bit is set high if data rate < 400Mbps => DDR clock < 200MHz. 1 : Will put High-Speed Transmitters in power-saving mode. Default value : 0

D-PHY spec : 38ns - 95 ns Actual value seen online : = REG_TCLKPREPARE timer + analog delay & slew on LP signals = REG_TCLKPREPARE * DDR Clock Period + [~25 ns -+ 5 ns) PROGRAMMED VALUE = ceil (65 ns / DDR Clock Period) Default value is programmed for 400 MHz
Transmitted pattern when REG_TXTRIGGERESC3 is asserted (first bit transmitted to last bit transmitted). Default: 01100010
Received pattern for which REG_RXTRIGGERESC3 is asserted (first bit transmitted to last bit transmitted). Default: 01100010
001: Lane0 -> clock lane 010: Lane1-> clock lane 011: Lane2 -> clock lane 101: Lane3 -> clock lane Other states are reserved. Default: 001
1 : Bypass LP-RX and LP-CD with fast buffers 0 : Do not bypass
1 : Bypass LP-RX and LP-CD comparator with fast buffers 0 : Do not bypass
1: Override EFUSE bits 0: Use EFUSE bits
11111: Max resistance 10000: Nominal resistance 00000: Min resistance
1: Override EFUSE bits 0: Use EFUSE bits
11111: Min current 10000: Nominal current 00000: Max current
1: Enable biasgen current (10uA) brought out. 0: Biasgen current is not brought out.(Note this testmode will be used only in testchips. Not expected to be used in SOC)
1: Control LDO output voltage through register bits. 0: Set LDO voltage to default
1: Control Bias current through register bits. 0: Set bias current to default.
1: LP-TX bypass controlled by register bit. 0: Default value
1: output impedance bypassed permanently 0: output impedance not bypassed at all
1: Override signals with register settings 0: Default
Set LPTX wakeup time counter in PWRCLK cycles or TXCLKESC cycles. In PWRCLK cycles (when PWRCMD is changed). 00: 250 (Default) 01: 313 10: 375 11: 500
LDO wakeup time counter in number of PWRCLK cycles (approximate) 00: 12500 (Default) 01: 6250 10: 31250 11: 62500
1: LPTX Data Taken from register 0: Default
26-17: Data for DX4,DY4,DX3,DY3, DX2,DY2, DX1,DY1, DX0,DY0 respectively
1: HS Data Taken from register 0: Default
15-11: Data for D4, D3, D2, D1 and D0 respectively
Fourth byte transmitted in loop-back mode
Third byte transmitted in loop-back mode
Second byte transmitted in loop-back mode
First byte transmitted in loop-back mode
TCLK-PRE used in loop-back mode - in number of DDR clocksDefault: 4 DDRCLK cycles
TCLK-POST used in loop-back mode - in number of DDR clocksDefault: 50 DDRCLK cycles
1: Override bandgap control bits with register value 0: Default
1: Enable sampled data to be brought out on WPO pins. 0: Normal mode
1: Enable sampled data to be brought out on WPO pins. 0: Normal mode
1: Override EFUSE bits 0: Use EFUSE bits
1: LDO in Hiz Mode 0: LDO not in Hiz mode
REG_THSTXEN is timing parameter for HSTXEN deassertion staggering. staggered time = REG_THSTXEN * (4 * Reg_Tlpxby2) Default : 1010 1000 ns 0000 : Reserved
1: NoTransition disabled 0: NoTransition controlled by FSM Default: 00000
